text: Table 15-1. (continued) Type Meaning in Life ThreadPriority This enum represents a threadâ€™s priority level (Highest, Normal, etc.). ThreadStart This delegate is used to specify the method to call for a given thread. Unlike the ParameterizedThreadStart delegate, targets of ThreadStart must always have the same prototype. ThreadState This enum specifies the valid states a thread may take (Running, Aborted, etc.). Timer This type provides a mechanism for executing a method at specified intervals. TimerCallback This delegate type is used in conjunction with Timer types.
